title: What is the major that is closest to AI? - Quora

response.answer_text: This depends heavily on the school you’re attending. At a lot of schools, a mix of the normal Computer Science and Applied Mathematics curriculum will get you the most exposure in class as an undergrad. However, there are some schools that offer degrees in Artificial Intelligence, other schools that offer a CS degree with a focus in AI, and depending on your specific interests, some schools offer cognitive science degrees, which borrows quite a bit from AI in some cases. Ultimately, I don’t think there’s a single answer to this question, it depends on the school you’ll be attending and your interests in the wide field of AI.

Most universities I'm familiar with have Artificial Intelligence as an emphasis area of Computer Science. This is at least the case with Stanford, where I've done my masters work on AI. Another option would be Statistics, which is particularly relevant for Machine Learning, the area of AI that's had the most advancement and practical applications recently.

Psychology. You need to know how the human functions, in order to try & mimic it. Also, there are many case studies in psychology regarding human “training”, which can show you how, for example, if you do A, B will happen…but, also, you have to be able to create the technology, so I guess you need to be able to write code…or you could just be like Steve Jobs, who had the ideas & vision and then just recruited the talent to make it a reality.

Probably Statistics. You'll need a combination of several skills that involve Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science. In addition, many schools offer Cognitive Science degree with emphasis in Artificial Intelligence.

Graduate degree in computer science with emphasis on optimization and linear algebra. Alternatively, applied or computational mathematics with emphasis in computer science. In either case, wherever linear algebra, computer science, and optimization meet.
